text:
I'm an aspiring graphics reporter, news-apps developer and data-viz enthusiast with a healthy amount of interest in [machine learning](https://github.com/duynguyen158/wann-nlp) from Hanoi, Vietnam. I'm currently a senior at New York University, where I study data science and journalism.

I recently finished an internship at CoinDesk, where — 11 time zones away from its Manhattan office — I created graphics and helped engineers integrate D3 into their CMS. Before that, I was automating audience dashboards with Python and D3 for Malcolm Gladwell's podcast company, Pushkin Industries, as its first data-science intern. Nowadays, I'm [introducing D3](https://observablehq.com/@duynguyen1678/xin-chao-d3-js) to Vietnamese journalists and volunteering in [front-end development](https://covidtracking.com/about-data/visualization-guide) for the COVID Tracking Project.

When I'm not working, I like to fiddle with visualization concepts on Observable or via React. Otherwise, you can always find me outdoors. Riding a CitiBike along the Hudson, Bill Evans in my ears. Annihilating fries at Shake Shack. Or, if I'm in Hanoi, embarassing my high-school [teammates](https://urbanisthanoi.com/hanoi-culture/16559-field-of-dreams-the-history-and-future-of-baseball-in-vietnam) with my subpar performance as a shortstop.
In the coming years, I hope to build the first data-visualization studio in Vietnam, where I'll devote everything I'll have learned to help Vietnamese newsrooms and businesses tell their stories.
